channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘We eat with our eyes’: Pepsi plays with purple sweet potatoes and various carrot colors as it races to remove dyes, says VP of R&D
item.description: “If you look at a plate of food, it’s generally the different kinds of colors that will tell you what you would like or not," exec Damien Browne says.

item.title: At Saudi Comedy Festival, American Free Speech Becomes the Punchline
item.description: American comics used Saudi Arabia’s first global comedy festival to skewer a debate raging at home. Critics said the event was part of Saudi efforts t...

item.title: The Global Sumud Flotilla Is Approaching Gaza. Here’s What to Know.
item.description: The Israeli government said it had detained activists onboard boats trying to take humanitarian goods to the enclave.

item.title: For Workers, Mixed Signals. For the Public, Limited Impact on Shutdown’s First Day.
item.description: Federal agencies gave shifting and mixed guidance to their work forces about who should come to work and who shouldn’t, but the initial effect on serv...

item.title: Warren Buffett’s last big deal? Berkshire Hathaway to buy Occidental Petroleum’s chemical division for $9.7 billion
item.description: Buffett wasn’t mentioned in materials on the deal, potentially signaling a passing of the torch to Vice Chair Greg Abel, who will become CEO in Januar...

item.title: Heading to L.A. for the Olympics? If You’re Into These Sports, You’re in the Wrong State.
item.description: Much of the Summer Games in 2028 will take place in Southern California. But two events, softball and canoe slalom, will be held in Oklahoma.

item.title: Iowa’s largest school district chooses to hire superintendent who lied about a doctorate as he sits in jail after immigration detention
item.description: Ian Roberts, who is challenging the order to deport him to his native Guyana, remained jailed Wednesday in Sioux City, about 150 miles north of Des Mo...

item.title: How Social Media Is Changing the Narrative of the Israel-Gaza War
item.description: Nearly two years into the conflict, social media is increasingly capturing the day-to-day toll in Gaza, as U.S. public opinion on the war shifts.

item.title: Biden’s Florida legacy: An economic boom, a magnet for immigrants and a solidly conservative red state
item.description: No state has been more affected by the increase in immigrants than Florida, according to internal government data obtained by The Associated Press.

item.title: Coinbase exec Jesse Pollak on the coming Base token—and why we can trust corporate blockchains
item.description: Pollak discussed the token, and said Base is committed to decentralization.

item.title: Here’s how the U.K. police determine whether an attack is terrorism.
item.description: The authorities have not yet said whether an attack at a synagogue in Manchester is considered to be an act of terrorism.

item.title: 4 People Injured After Stabbing Outside Manchester Synagogue, UK Police Say
item.description: The stabbing in Manchester, England, came on Yom Kippur, the holiest day in the Jewish calendar.

item.title: Israel Intercepts Gaza-Bound Activist Boats

item.title: Live Updates: Police Say Deadly Attack Outside U.K. Synagogue Was Terrorism
